Description: Body and foot sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate or shallow bowl, with low ring foot; yellowish white slip; interior: outer area glazed black; band of black billets between pairs of narrow brown bands surround tondo; in tondo, black-figure decoration, sphinx (only head with added red for hair, neck and top of wing with trace of red), to left; incised rosette with red centre as filling ornament; exterior: reserved with alternating black and red bands; black band at junction with foot; outside edge of foot black; resting surface reserved (and worn); recessed underside of foot reserved with two reddish black bands.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group B of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Whilst this may not be a coherent group, the animals depicted on vases of this group all have elongated bodies and the rosette has a daisy shape.
Bibliographic references: Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 141, no. 837)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 147, p. 319, no. 1407, pl. 180)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2140) (phase 2)
